snippet: Rick Santorum is rejoicing in his recent rise in the polls, yet confronting some stark realities that his campaign cannot ignore.
abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Rick Santorum, emboldened by surge in poll numbers, is attempting to cement his status as the best anti-Mitt Romney candidate in final days before Iowa caucuses; has emerged as a top contender to unite the crucial, yet fractured, evangelical Christian vote, though in order to gain wider support, Santorum must also portray himself as viable opponent for Barack Obama.
lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum is rejoicing in his recent rise in the polls, yet confronting some stark realities that his campaign cannot ignore.

headline.main: Santorum Seeks to Broaden His Appeal Beyond Evangelicals
headline.print_headline: Santorum’s Challenge: Broaden His Appeal Beyond Evangelical Christians
